title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK3272-SiP and RAK3272LP-SiP Breakout Boards Overview
content: The RAK3272-SiP and RAK3272LP-SiP Breakout Boards were designed to allow easy access to the[RAK3172-SiP/RAK3172LP-SiP](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisduo/rak3172-sip/overview/) module pins to simplify development and testing. The two SiP module variants use different RF output paths to optimize current consumption depending on the application. RAK3172-SiP uses RFO_HP while RAK3172LP-SiP uses the RFO_LP on the STM32WL SoC transceiver.
parent_content:
The RAK3272-SiP and RAK3272LP-SiP Breakout Boards were designed to allow easy access to the[RAK3172-SiP/RAK3172LP-SiP](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisduo/rak3172-sip/overview/) module pins to simplify development and testing. The two SiP module variants use different RF output paths to optimize current consumption depending on the application. RAK3172-SiP uses RFO_HP while RAK3172LP-SiP uses the RFO_LP on the STM32WL SoC transceiver.  
The microcontroller's GPIO pins are accessible through 2.54 mm headers. The breakout board is powered by either the RAK3172-SiP or the RAK3172LP-SiP, both of which are based on the STM32WLE5JC. The STM32WLE5JC belongs to the [STM32WLE5x](https://www.st.com/en/microcontrollers-microprocessors/stm32wlex.html) family. It features an Arm® Cortex®-M4 core operating at 48 MHz and includes a sub-GHz radio based on the Semtech SX126x.  
The board complies with Class A, B, & C of LoRaWAN 1.0.3 specifications and also features LoRa Point-to-Point (P2P) communication mode, which helps you in implementing your own customized long-range LoRa network quickly. It is also RUI3 compatible which allows you to create custom firmware using RUI3 APIs.

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK3272-SiP and RAK3272LP-SiP Breakout Boards Overview

The two SiP module variants use different RF output paths to optimize current consumption depending on the application. RAK3172-SiP uses RFO_HP while RAK3172LP-SiP uses the RFO_LP on the STM32WL SoC transceiver.  
The microcontroller's GPIO pins are accessible through 2.54 mm headers. The breakout board is powered by either the RAK3172-SiP or the RAK3172LP-SiP, both of which are based on the STM32WLE5JC. The STM32WLE5JC belongs to the [STM32WLE5x](https://www.st.com/en/microcontrollers-microprocessors/stm32wlex.html) family. It features an Arm® Cortex®-M4 core operating at 48 MHz and includes a sub-GHz radio based on the Semtech SX126x.  
The board complies with Class A, B, & C of LoRaWAN 1.0.3 specifications and also features LoRa Point-to-Point (P2P) communication mode, which helps you in implementing your own customized long-range LoRa network quickly. It is also RUI3 compatible which allows you to create custom firmware using RUI3 APIs.

The RAK3272-SiP and RAK3272LP-SiP Breakout Boards were designed to allow easy access to the[RAK3172-SiP/RAK3172LP-SiP](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisduo/rak3172-sip/overview/) module pins to simplify development and testing. The two SiP module variants use different RF output paths to optimize current consumption depending on the application. RAK3172-SiP uses RFO_HP while RAK3172LP-SiP uses the RFO_LP on the STM32WL SoC transceiver.  
The microcontroller's GPIO pins are accessible through 2.54 mm headers. The breakout board is powered by either the RAK3172-SiP or the RAK3172LP-SiP, both of which are based on the STM32WLE5JC. The STM32WLE5JC belongs to the [STM32WLE5x](https://www.st.com/en/microcontrollers-microprocessors/stm32wlex.html) family. It features an Arm® Cortex®-M4 core operating at 48 MHz and includes a sub-GHz radio based on the Semtech SX126x.  
The board complies with Class A, B, & C of LoRaWAN 1.0.3 specifications and also features LoRa Point-to-Point (P2P) communication mode, which helps you in implementing your own customized long-range LoRa network quickly. It is also RUI3 compatible which allows you to create custom firmware using RUI3 APIs.

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interface > SWD Programming Interface > ST-Link Programming Pin Connections
content:
When programming via an [ST-Link](https://www.st.com/en/development-tools/st-link-v2.html) tool, it is required to have all of the following four pins connected to your ST-Link tool:  
- 3V3
- SWDIO
- SWCLK
- GND  
For more information refer to the [Upload firmware using ST-Link](#upload-firmware-using-st-link) section.
parent_content:
When programming via an [ST-Link](https://www.st.com/en/development-tools/st-link-v2.html) tool, it is required to have all of the following four pins connected to your ST-Link tool:  
- 3V3
- SWDIO
- SWCLK
- GND  
For more information refer to the [Upload firmware using ST-Link](#upload-firmware-using-st-link) section.

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interface > UART Interface > UART Interfaces on RAK3272-SIP Breakout Board
content:
This board has two UART interfaces:  
- UART2 (default interface for firmware uploading and AT Commands)
- UART1
parent_content:
This board has two UART interfaces:  
- UART2 (default interface for firmware uploading and AT Commands)
- UART1

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interface > RF Interface > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Antenna Connector and Warning
content:
**J2** is the RP-SMA antenna connector.  
> **WARNING:** Before powering the RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board, you should install the LoRa antenna first. Not doing so might damage the board.  
Ensure that you use a LoRa antenna with an RP-SMA male connector that is compatible with the selected LoRa frequency.  
> **Image:** LoRa antenna with RP-SMA male connector
parent_content:
**J2** is the RP-SMA antenna connector.  
> **WARNING:** Before powering the RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board, you should install the LoRa antenna first. Not doing so might damage the board.  
Ensure that you use a LoRa antenna with an RP-SMA male connector that is compatible with the selected LoRa frequency.  
> **Image:** LoRa antenna with RP-SMA male connector

content:

| PA2                | RX                             |
| PA3                | TX                             |
| 3V3                | 3.3V                     |
| GND                | Ground                         |

|             | Russia        | RU864     |

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Electrical Characteristics > RAK3272-SiP Power Supply Scheme > Power Supply Regulators for RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board
content:
The RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board can use two different power supply regulators: **LDO** or **DCDC** (SMPS) - Switch Mode Power Supply.  
The use of **DCDC** is optional but improves the power efficiency. If you want to disable the **DCDC** mode, then you need to remove the L1 inductor, as shown in **Figure 6**.  
> **Image:** RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board DCDC inductor
parent_content:
The RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board can use two different power supply regulators: **LDO** or **DCDC** (SMPS) - Switch Mode Power Supply.  
The use of **DCDC** is optional but improves the power efficiency. If you want to disable the **DCDC** mode, then you need to remove the L1 inductor, as shown in **Figure 6**.  
> **Image:** RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board DCDC inductor

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Electrical Characteristics > Operating Voltage > Voltage Parameters for RAK3272-SIP-Breakout-Board [TABLE]
content:
| Parameter                            | Minimum | Typical | Maximum | Unit      |
| ------------------------------------ | ------- | ------- | ------- | --------- |
| VCC                                  | 1.8     |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VDDA (ADC or COMP used)              | 1.71    |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VDDA (VREFBUF used)                  | 2.4     |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VDDA (ADC, COMP or VREFBUF not used) | 0       |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |

| VDDA (VREFBUF used)                  | 2.4     |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VDDA (ADC, COMP or VREFBUF not used) | 0       |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VBAT                                 | 1.55    |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VDDSMPS                              | 1.8     |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VDDRF                                | 1.8     |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VDDPA                                | 1.8     |         | 3.6     | Volts (V) |
| VREF+                                | 2.0     |         | VDDA    | Volts (V) |
| VREF+ (VDDA < 2V)                    | VDDA    |         | VDDA    | Volts (V) |

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Software > Upload Firmware Using RAK DFU > Upload Firmware to RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Using RAK DFU Tool
content:
The **bin file** contains only the application code and requires the **RAK DFU Tool** for uploading to the RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board through UART2.  
The RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board uses UART2 serial pins to upload the latest firmware. Refer to the [Connect to the RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisduo/rak3272-sip-breakout-board/quickstart/#connect-to-the-rak3272-sip-breakout-board) section.
parent_content:
The **bin file** contains only the application code and requires the **RAK DFU Tool** for uploading to the RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board through UART2.  
The RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board uses UART2 serial pins to upload the latest firmware. Refer to the [Connect to the RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisduo/rak3272-sip-breakout-board/quickstart/#connect-to-the-rak3272-sip-breakout-board) section.

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Software > Upload Firmware Using ST-Link > Upload Hex File Using STM32CubeProgrammer and ST-Link
content:
The **hex file** contains both the bootloader and the application code.  
You need to use the [STM32CubeProgrammer](https://wiki.st.com/stm32mpu/wiki/STM32CubeProgrammer) and the **ST-Link** tool [to upload the hex file](https://learn.rakwireless.com/hc/en-us/articles/26687606549911-How-To-Guide-STM32CubeProgrammer-for-RAK-Modules). Use the diagram shown in **Figure 9** to connect the **ST-Link**.  
> **Image:** RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board ST-Link connection
parent_content:
The **hex file** contains both the bootloader and the application code.  
You need to use the [STM32CubeProgrammer](https://wiki.st.com/stm32mpu/wiki/STM32CubeProgrammer) and the **ST-Link** tool [to upload the hex file](https://learn.rakwireless.com/hc/en-us/articles/26687606549911-How-To-Guide-STM32CubeProgrammer-for-RAK-Modules). Use the diagram shown in **Figure 9** to connect the **ST-Link**.  
> **Image:** RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board ST-Link connection

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Software > Firmware/OS > Firmware Download Links for RAK3272-SiP and RAK3272LP-SiP Breakout Boards [TABLE]

| RAK3272LP-SiP (.hex) | RUI3 (Bootloader and App) | [Download](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/RUI/RUI3/Image/RAK3272LP-SiP_latest_final.hex) |

title: RAK3272-SiP WisDuo Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3272-SiP Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Certification > AT Command Guide for CE and FCC Certifications
content:
> **TIP:** Note
For CE and FCC certifications we provide an AT command guide.
You can find it in our [RUI3 documentation](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/software-apis-and-libraries/rui3/certification-guide) or get it from our [Download Center](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/#RUI/RUI3/Certification%20Guide/).
